alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:03AM CDT until May 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Pembina, Kittson, Marshall and Walsh Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Grand Forks, Marshall and Walsh Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Traill and Norman Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at East Grand Forks. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 36.5 feet, River Heights Trail Head and Park closed. (East Grand Forks) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 37.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Monday was 38.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday evening and continue falling to 25.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
